data.benefits:
1. Ensures Minimum Tax Payment: The primary benefit of AMT is that it ensures that companies availing of tax exemptions or deductions still contribute at least a minimum amount of tax to the government’s revenue, thus preventing tax avoidance. 

2. Tax on Adjusted Total Income: AMT ensures that companies that have large deductions but may not be paying adequate tax are taxed on a more consistent basis by taxing them on their adjusted total income. 

3. Carry Forward of AMT Credit: If the AMT paid is higher than the regular tax liability, the excess AMT can be carried forward for 15 years to offset future regular tax liabilities. This allows companies to adjust the AMT paid against regular taxes in the subsequent years when their taxable income increases. 

4. Incentive for Compliance: By ensuring that even companies claiming deductions pay a minimum tax, AMT encourages companies to comply with tax regulations without misusing exemptions.
data.eligibility:
• Domestic Company: The provision applies to companies incorporated in India. Foreign companies are not subject to AMT. 
  • Claiming Deductions: The company must have claimed deductions under sections like 10AA (SEZ), 80-IA (infrastructure), 80-IB (small-scale industries), 80-IC (specified states), or similar provisions. 
  • Taxable Income Below Regular Tax Liability: AMT applies when the taxable income of a company, after claiming these exemptions, is low and the regular tax liability calculated on such income is less than the AMT. If the regular tax is lower, AMT is applicable. 
  • Adjusted Total Income Calculation: If the company claims deductions, the adjusted total income will be calculated by adding back the deductions claimed under certain sections (like 80-IA, 10AA, etc.) to the taxable income.
data.conditions:
1. Claiming Deductions: The company must have claimed exemptions or deductions (like those under Section 10AA, 80-IA) that lower its regular taxable income. 
  2. Regular Tax Liability Below AMT: If the regular tax liability (calculated on taxable income) is less than the AMT, then the company must pay the AMT. 
  3. Minimum Tax Calculation: AMT is calculated at a rate of 18.5% on the adjusted total income (which includes income after adding back the deductions claimed). The company must pay the higher of AMT or regular tax. 
  4. Book Profits and Adjusted Income: For AMT purposes, the company’s adjusted income (after adding back deductions like 80-IA or 10AA) will be used to calculate AMT at the rate of 18.5%.
  5.  Carry Forward of AMT: If the AMT is paid, the excess amount (the difference between AMT and the regular tax) can be carried forward for up to 15 years to be set off against regular tax liabilities in future years.

data.how_to_apply: Claim by filing Income Tax Return
data.additional_info: All taxpayers to whom AMT provisions are applicable is required to obtain a report from Chartered Accountant certifying that adjusted total income and AMT have been computed as per provisions of Income-tax Act, in Form No. 29C and furnish the report on or before the due date for filing the return of income. Report can be filed electronically along with return of income.
